string.name: intro_answer
string.ul:
•
I had the chance to work on a new POS system with the Poseidon team
 
•
Learned Android, Git, Kotlin and much more
 
•
Intro to my learnings

string.name: self_intro_answer
string.ul:
•
I attend the University of Wisconsin-Madison
 
•
I study Computer Engineering and Computer Science
 
•
I live in Chicago
 
•
I love to go the gym, play guitar, and I play on an eSports team for the game Valorant

string.name: android_a_one
string.ul:
•
Android is a mobile operating system that runs on top of linux!
 
•
An operating system integrates hardware and software resources

resources.string: What can we build with Android?

string.name: android_a_two
string.ul:
•
Apps for smartphones, watches, tablets and more!
 
•
Can also create something like the POS

resources.string: How to get started on Android!

string.name: android_a_three
string.ul:
•
Install Android Studio for an IDE!
 
•
developer.android.com has many resources to begin

string.name: kotlin_a_one
string.ul:
•
Statically typed programming language that started development in 2010
 
•
In 2017, Kotlin was announced to be an official language for Android!
 
•
Kotlin and Java are easily interoperable

resources.string: Is there any prior experience needed for Kotlin?

string.name: kotlin_a_two
string.ul:
•
If you are a Java developer, you are in for a joy ride!
 
•
No prior experience needed!

resources.string: How can I get started on Kotlin?

string.name: kotlin_a_three
string.ul:
•
Thankfully, Kotlin's developers have been so kind in providing various resources for starting!
 
•
Lazy Java developer by Renaud Cerrato.

string.name: xml_a_one
string.ul:
•
XML stands for eXtensible Markup Language
 
•
Allows you to describe data, in the case of Android, layouts, views, values, Strings and colors!

resources.string: Where does XML come into play for Android?

string.name: xml_a_two
string.ul:
•
Create layouts for Android, a sort of UI interface!
 
•
The text you are reading now, colors of the text, vector images are all done in XML!

resources.string: How can I get started on learning XML?

string.name: xml_a_three
string.ul:
•
Specifically for Android learning, XML can be learned from various sources, one being LinkedIn!
 
•
Android's website also includes many videos and resources for XML!

string.name: binding_a_one
string.ul:
•
Android allows the user to interact between Kotlin/Java logic code and XML views.
 
•
Before, developers used Kotlin synthetics and the Butterknife library for Java, now we have View Binding!

string.name: binding_a_two
string.ul:
•
View Binding allows for easier code to be written for interaction between views
 
•
Allows for a safer way to reference XML layout views
 
•
In Kotlin synthetics, it gets difficult to differentiate views
 
•
Creates a way for you to utilize the correct view being used

resources.string: How can I get started on implementing it correctly?

string.name: binding_a_three
git_a_one
string.ul:
\n•
Git is a software that allows for tracking of changes in any set of files\n

string.name: git_a_two
string.ul:
•
You have possibly heard of a repo which is short of repository!
 
•
There are 2 types of repos, one being the remote repo
 
•
The remote repo is where code is stored on a code hosting service!
 
•
The local repo is where you have a copy of the remote repo locally on your machine

resources.string: How do the remote and local repos interact?

string.name: git_a_three
string.ul:
•
To save any changes made on your local repo, you need to first commit your changes locally
 
•
To then save those changes onto the remote repo, you need to push your changes

resources.string: What other terms are there in Git?

string.name: git_a_four
string.ul:
•
In Git, we also have branches and operations like merging and rebasing
 
•
Will link a Confluence power point made by my mentor, Erica, which explains everything in detail!

string.name: jira_a_one
string.ul:
•
Jira is a tool that helps teams work together in a collaborative environment, such as agile development
 
•
You can track tickets and issues, create roadmaps, and integrate with development tools!

string.name: jira_a_two
string.ul:
•
Agile development is a framework that practices solving solutions in the form of sprints!
 
•
For Poseidon, we work in 3 week sprints, which is the time frame in which we get an amount of work done by the next sprint

string.name: mvvm_a_one
string.ul:
•
There are multiple ways in which we can structure our code, some that have been put in place and developed over time
 
•
Model-View-Controller (MVC) 
•Model-View-Presenter (MVP) 
•Model-View-ViewModel (MVVM) 
•Model-View-Intent(MVI)

resources.string: Poseidon\'s use of MVP and MVVM, what are models and views?

string.name: mvvm_a_two
string.ul:
•
A model is a layer of data or information of the software
 
•
A view is a class that displays visual elements on the screen
 
•
MVP is where we have a Presenter be able to communicate with a model and a view
 
•
MVVM has a ViewModel instead of a presenter that is the brains and the logic of the interface
 
•
Presenter in MVP vs the ViewModel in MVVM

string.name: pos_a_one
string.ul:
\n•
A Point of Sale is a system that allows the merchant to collect information to complete a transaction based on what was asked/purchased by the customer.\n

resources.string: Poseidon\'s creation of a new POS

string.name: pos_a_two
string.ul:
•
Focus has been on Taco Bell to convert their Xenial system to a new system that allows for an easier experience
 
•
Creates easier experiences for the Service Champion, easy to deploy on Android tablets, and we would not have to rely on outside companies to supply our POS system.

resources.string: Will we create the same sort of POS for other brands?

string.name: pos_a_three
string.ul:
•
We want to keep some implementations the same while also being flexible in customization
 
•
Need to keep menu, payment, employee services and others flexible across brands
 
•
We would then be able to create brand specific modules that are easily implemented with Yum's shared modules.
